custom_speech.description: Optional configuration for custom speech models.

phrase_list.description: Optional list of phrase hints to bias recognition.

type.description: The type of noise reduction model.

style.description: Optional avatar style, such as emotional tone or speaking style.

model.description: Base model to use for the avatar. Required for photo avatar.

customized.description: Indicates whether the avatar is customized or not.

video.description: Optional video configuration including resolution, bitrate, and codec.

scene.description: Configuration for the avatar's zoom level, position, rotation and movement amplitude in the video frame.

output_protocol.description: Output protocol for avatar streaming. Default is 'webrtc'.

threshold_level.description: Threshold level setting. Recommended instead of `threshold`. One of `low`, `medium`, `high`, or `default`.

timeout_ms.description: Timeout in milliseconds. Recommended instead of `timeout`.

Background.description: Defines a video background, either a solid color or an image URL (mutually exclusive).

color.description: Background color in hex format (e.g., `#00FF00FF`). Cannot be set if `image_url` is provided.

image_url.description: Background image URL. Cannot be set if `color` is provided.

BasicFillerResponseConfig.description:
Configuration for basic/static filler response generation.
Randomly selects from configured texts when any trigger condition is met.

texts.description: List of filler text options to randomly select from.

ClientEventConversationItemCreate.description:
Add a new Item to the Conversation's context, including messages, function
calls, and function call responses. This event can be used both to populate a
"history" of the conversation and to add new items mid-stream, but has the
current limitation that it cannot populate assistant audio messages.
If successful, the server will respond with a `conversation.item.created`
event, otherwise an `error` event will be sent.

event_id.description: Optional client-generated ID used to identify this event.

previous_item_id.description:
The ID of the preceding item after which the new item will be inserted.
If not set, the new item will be appended to the end of the conversation.
If set to `root`, the new item will be added to the beginning of the conversation.
If set to an existing ID, it allows an item to be inserted mid-conversation. If the
ID cannot be found, an error will be returned and the item will not be added.

ClientEventConversationItemDelete.description:
Send this event when you want to remove any item from the conversation
history. The server will respond with a `conversation.item.deleted` event,
unless the item does not exist in the conversation history, in which case the
server will respond with an error.

item_id.description: The ID of the item to delete.

ClientEventConversationItemRetrieve.description:
Send this event when you want to retrieve the server's representation of a specific item in the conversation history. This is useful, for example, to inspect user audio after noise cancellation and VAD.
The server will respond with a `conversation.item.retrieved` event,
unless the item does not exist in the conversation history, in which case the
server will respond with an error.

item_id.description: The ID of the item to retrieve.

ClientEventConversationItemTruncate.description:
Send this event to truncate a previous assistant message’s audio. The server
will produce audio faster than voicelive, so this event is useful when the user
interrupts to truncate audio that has already been sent to the client but not
yet played. This will synchronize the server's understanding of the audio with
the client's playback.
Truncating audio will delete the server-side text transcript to ensure there
is not text in the context that hasn't been heard by the user.
If successful, the server will respond with a `conversation.item.truncated`
event.

item_id.description:
The ID of the assistant message item to truncate. Only assistant message
items can be truncated.

content_index.description: The index of the content part to truncate. Set this to 0.

audio_end_ms.description:
Inclusive duration up to which audio is truncated, in milliseconds. If
the audio_end_ms is greater than the actual audio duration, the server
will respond with an error.

ClientEventInputAudioBufferAppend.description:
Send this event to append audio bytes to the input audio buffer. The audio
buffer is temporary storage you can write to and later commit. In Server VAD
mode, the audio buffer is used to detect speech and the server will decide
when to commit. When Server VAD is disabled, you must commit the audio buffer
manually.

The client may choose how much audio to place in each event up to a maximum
of 15 MiB, for example streaming smaller chunks from the client may allow the
VAD to be more responsive. Unlike made other client events, the server will
not send a confirmation response to this event.

audio.description:
Base64-encoded audio. This must be in the format specified by the
`input_audio_format` field in the session configuration.

ClientEventInputAudioBufferClear.description:
Send this event to clear the audio bytes in the buffer. The server will
respond with an `input_audio_buffer.cleared` event.

ClientEventInputAudioBufferCommit.description:
Send this event to commit the user input audio buffer, which will create a
new user message item in the conversation. This event will produce an error
if the input audio buffer is empty. When in Server VAD mode, the client does
not need to send this event, the server will commit the audio buffer
automatically.
Committing the input audio buffer will trigger input audio transcription
(if enabled in session configuration), but it will not create a response
from the model. The server will respond with an `input_audio_buffer.committed`
event.

ClientEventInputAudioClear.description: Clears all input audio currently being streamed.

ClientEventInputAudioTurnAppend.description: Appends audio data to an ongoing input turn.

turn_id.description: The ID of the turn this audio is part of.

ClientEventInputAudioTurnCancel.description: Cancels an in-progress input audio turn.

turn_id.description: The ID of the turn to cancel.

ClientEventInputAudioTurnEnd.description: Marks the end of an audio input turn.

turn_id.description: The ID of the audio turn being ended.

ClientEventInputAudioTurnStart.description: Indicates the start of a new audio input turn.

turn_id.description: Unique identifier for the input audio turn.

ClientEventResponseCancel.description:
Send this event to cancel an in-progress response. The server will respond
with a `response.cancelled` event or an error if there is no response to
cancel.

response_id.description:
A specific response ID to cancel - if not provided, will cancel an
in-progress response in the default conversation.

ClientEventResponseCreate.description:
This event instructs the server to create a Response, which means triggering
model inference. When in Server VAD mode, the server will create Responses
automatically.
A Response will include at least one Item, and may have two, in which case
the second will be a function call. These Items will be appended to the
conversation history.
The server will respond with a `response.created` event, events for Items
and content created, and finally a `response.done` event to indicate the
Response is complete.
The `response.create` event includes inference configuration like
`instructions`, and `temperature`. These fields will override the Session's
configuration for this Response only.

additional_instructions.description: additional instructions (system prompt) appended to the default instructions of the session. Only affects this response only.

ClientEventSessionAvatarConnect.description:
Sent when the client connects and provides its SDP (Session Description Protocol)

for avatar-related media negotiation.

ClientEventSessionUpdate.description:
Send this event to update the session’s default configuration.
The client may send this event at any time to update any field,
except for `voice`. However, note that once a session has been
initialized with a particular `model`, it can’t be changed to
another model using `session.update`.
When the server receives a `session.update`, it will respond
with a `session.updated` event showing the full, effective configuration.
Only the fields that are present are updated. To clear a field like
`instructions`, pass an empty string.

ClientEventType.description: Client event types used in VoiceLive protocol.

ContentPart.description: Base for any content part; discriminated by `type`.

ConversationItemBase.description: The item to add to the conversation.

ConversationRequestItem.description: Base for any response item; discriminated by `type`.

EouDetection.description: Top-level union for end-of-utterance (EOU) semantic detection configuration.

agent_context_type.description: The context type to use when invoking the Foundry agent. Defaults to 'agent_context'.

return_agent_response_directly.description: Whether to return the agent's response directly in the VoiceLive response. Set to false means to ask the voice live to rewrite the response.

urls.description: List of ICE server URLs (e.g., TURN or STUN endpoints).

username.description: Optional username used for authentication with the ICE server.

max_completion_tokens.description: Maximum number of tokens to generate for the filler response.

ReasoningEffort.description:
Constrains effort on reasoning for reasoning models. Check model documentation for supported values for each model.
Reducing reasoning effort can result in faster responses and fewer tokens used on reasoning in a response.

values.name: none
values.description: No reasoning effort.

values.name: minimal
values.description: Minimal reasoning effort.

values.name: low
values.description: Low reasoning effort - faster responses with less reasoning.

values.name: medium
values.description: Medium reasoning effort - balanced between speed and reasoning depth.

values.name: high
values.description: High reasoning effort - more thorough reasoning, may take longer.

values.name: xhigh
values.description: Extra high reasoning effort - maximum reasoning depth.

RequestAudioContentPart.description: An audio content part for a request.

RequestImageContentPartDetail.description: Specifies an image's detail level. Can be 'auto', 'low', 'high', or an unknown future value.

values.name: auto
values.description: Automatically select an appropriate detail level.

values.name: low
values.description: Use a lower detail level to reduce bandwidth or cost.

values.name: high
values.description: Use a higher detail level—potentially more resource-intensive.

modalities.description: The modalities to be used in the session.

animation.description: The animation configuration for the session.

Input audio sampling rate in Hz. Available values:

- For g711_alaw/g711_ulaw: 8000

turn_detection.description: Type of turn detection to use.

input_audio_noise_reduction.description: Configuration for input audio noise reduction.

input_audio_echo_cancellation.description: Configuration for echo cancellation during server-side audio processing.

avatar.description: Configuration for avatar streaming and behavior during the session.

output_audio_timestamp_types.description: Types of timestamps to include in audio response content.

tools.description: Configuration for tools to be used during the session, if applicable.

tool_choice.description: Specifies which tools the model is allowed to call during the session.

temperature.description: Controls the randomness of the model's output. Range: 0.0 to 1.0. Default is 0.7.

max_response_output_tokens.description: Maximum number of tokens to generate in the response. Default is unlimited.

reasoning_effort.description:
Constrains effort on reasoning for reasoning models. Check model documentation for supported values for each model.
Reducing reasoning effort can result in faster responses and fewer tokens used on reasoning in a response.

filler_response.description: Configuration for filler response generation during latency or tool calls.

RequestTextContentPart.description: A text content part for a request.

id.description: The unique ID of the response.

status.description:
The final status of the response.

One of: `completed`, `cancelled`, `failed`, `incomplete`, or `in_progress`.

output.description: The list of output items generated by the response.

usage.description:
Usage statistics for the Response, this will correspond to billing. A
VoiceLive API session will maintain a conversation context and append new
Items to the Conversation, thus output from previous turns (text and
audio tokens) will become the input for later turns.

conversation_id.description:
Which conversation the response is added to, determined by the `conversation`
field in the `response.create` event. If `auto`, the response will be added to
the default conversation and the value of `conversation_id` will be an id like
`conv_1234`. If `none`, the response will not be added to any conversation and
the value of `conversation_id` will be `null`. If responses are being triggered
by server VAD, the response will be added to the default conversation, thus
the `conversation_id` will be an id like `conv_1234`.

modalities.description:
The set of modalities the model used to respond. If there are multiple modalities,
the model will pick one, for example if `modalities` is `["text", "audio"]`, the model
could be responding in either text or audio.

output_audio_format.description: The format of output audio. Options are `pcm16`, `g711_ulaw`, or `g711_alaw`.

values.name: pcm16
values.description: 16-bit PCM audio format at default sampling rate (24kHz)

values.name: pcm16_8000hz
values.description: 16-bit PCM audio format at 8kHz sampling rate

values.name: pcm16_16000hz
values.description: 16-bit PCM audio format at 16kHz sampling rate

values.name: g711_ulaw
values.description: G.711 μ-law (mu-law) audio format at 8kHz sampling rate

values.name: g711_alaw
values.description: G.711 A-law audio format at 8kHz sampling rate

temperature.description: Sampling temperature for the model, limited to [0.6, 1.2]. Defaults to 0.8.

max_output_tokens.description:
Maximum number of output tokens for a single assistant response,
inclusive of tool calls, that was used in this response.

metadata.description:
Set of up to 16 key-value pairs that can be attached to an object.
This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.
Keys can be a maximum of 64 characters long and values can be a maximum of 512 characters long.

ResponseAudioContentPart.description: An audio content part for a response.

ResponseCreateParams.description: Create a new VoiceLive response with these parameters

commit.description: Whether to commit the response to the conversation. Defaults to true.

cancel_previous.description: Whether to cancel any ongoing generation before starting this one. Defaults to true.

append_input_items.description: Input items to append to the conversation context before generating a response.

input_items.description:
Input items to be used as the context for this response.
An empty array clears previous context.

modalities.description:
The set of modalities the model can respond with. To disable audio,
set this to ["text"].

instructions.description:
The default system instructions (i.e. system message) prepended to model
calls. This field allows the client to guide the model on desired
responses. The model can be instructed on response content and format,
(e.g. "be extremely succinct", "act friendly", "here are examples of good
responses") and on audio behavior (e.g. "talk quickly", "inject emotion
into your voice", "laugh frequently"). The instructions are not guaranteed
to be followed by the model, but they provide guidance to the model on the
desired behavior.

Note that the server sets default instructions which will be used if this
field is not set and are visible in the `session.created` event at the
start of the session.

output_audio_format.description: The format of output audio. Options are `pcm16`, `g711_ulaw`, or `g711_alaw`.

values.name: pcm16
values.description: 16-bit PCM audio format at default sampling rate (24kHz)

values.name: pcm16_8000hz
values.description: 16-bit PCM audio format at 8kHz sampling rate

values.name: pcm16_16000hz
values.description: 16-bit PCM audio format at 16kHz sampling rate

values.name: g711_ulaw
values.description: G.711 μ-law (mu-law) audio format at 8kHz sampling rate

values.name: g711_alaw
values.description: G.711 A-law audio format at 8kHz sampling rate

tool_choice.description:
How the model chooses tools. Options are `auto`, `none`, `required`, or
specify a function, like `{"type": "function", "function": {"name": "my_function"}}`.

temperature.description: Sampling temperature for the model, limited to [0.6, 1.2]. Defaults to 0.8.

max_output_tokens.description:
Maximum number of output tokens for a single assistant response,
inclusive of tool calls. Provide an integer between 1 and 4096 to
limit output tokens, or `inf` for the maximum available tokens for a
given model. Defaults to `inf`.

pre_generated_assistant_message.description:
Create the response with pre-generated assistant message. The message item would be
added into the conversation history and returned with synthesized audio output in the created response.

reasoning_effort.description:
Constrains effort on reasoning for reasoning models. Check model documentation for supported values for each model.
Reducing reasoning effort can result in faster responses and fewer tokens used on reasoning in a response.

metadata.description:
Set of up to 16 key-value pairs that can be attached to an object.
This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.
Keys can be a maximum of 64 characters long and values can be a maximum of 512 characters long.

ResponseFoundryAgentCallItem.description: A response item that represents a call to a Foundry agent.

name.description: The name of the Foundry agent.

arguments.description: The arguments for the agent call.

agent_response_id.description: The ID of the agent response, if any.

output.description: The output of the agent call.

error.description: The error, if any, from the agent call.

ResponseFunctionCallItem.description: A function call item within a conversation.

ResponseFunctionCallOutputItem.description: A function call output item within a conversation.

ResponseItem.description: Base for any response item; discriminated by `type`.

ResponseItemStatus.description: Indicates the processing status of a response item.

values.name: in_progress
values.description: Item that is in progress.

values.name: completed
values.description: Item has been fully processed and is complete.

values.name: incomplete
values.description: Item has been processed but is incomplete.

ResponseMCPApprovalRequestItem.description: A response item that represents a request for approval to call an MCP tool.

arguments.description: The arguments for the tool call.

name.description: The name of the tool to call.

server_label.description: The label of the server that provides the tool.

ResponseMCPApprovalResponseItem.description: A response item that represents a response to an MCP approval request.

approval_request_id.description: The ID of the approval request.

approve.description: Whether the tool call was approved.

reason.description: The reason for the approval decision.

ResponseMCPCallItem.description: A response item that represents a call to an MCP tool.

approval_request_id.description: The ID of the approval request, if any.

arguments.description: The arguments for the tool call.

server_label.description: The label of the server that provides the tool.

name.description: The name of the tool to call.

output.description: The output of the tool call.

error.description: The error, if any, from the tool call.

ResponseMCPListToolItem.description: A response item that lists the tools available on an MCP server.

tools.description: The tools available on the server.

server_label.description: The label of the server that provides the tools.

ResponseMessageItem.description: Base type for message item within a conversation.

ResponseSession.description: Base for session configuration in the response.

modalities.description: The modalities to be used in the session.

animation.description: The animation configuration for the session.

voice.description: The voice configuration for the session.

instructions.description: Optional instructions to guide the model's behavior throughout the session.

input_audio_sampling_rate.description:
Input audio sampling rate in Hz. Available values:

- For pcm16: 8000, 16000, 24000

- For g711_alaw/g711_ulaw: 8000

values.name: pcm16
values.description: 16-bit PCM audio format at default sampling rate (24kHz)

values.name: g711_ulaw
values.description: G.711 μ-law (mu-law) audio format at 8kHz sampling rate

values.name: g711_alaw
values.description: G.711 A-law audio format at 8kHz sampling rate

values.name: pcm16
values.description: 16-bit PCM audio format at default sampling rate (24kHz)

values.name: pcm16_8000hz
values.description: 16-bit PCM audio format at 8kHz sampling rate

values.name: pcm16_16000hz
values.description: 16-bit PCM audio format at 16kHz sampling rate

values.name: g711_ulaw
values.description: G.711 μ-law (mu-law) audio format at 8kHz sampling rate

values.name: g711_alaw
values.description: G.711 A-law audio format at 8kHz sampling rate

turn_detection.description: Type of turn detection to use.

input_audio_noise_reduction.description: Configuration for input audio noise reduction.

input_audio_echo_cancellation.description: Configuration for echo cancellation during server-side audio processing.

avatar.description: Configuration for avatar streaming and behavior during the session.

output_audio_timestamp_types.description: Types of timestamps to include in audio response content.

tools.description: Configuration for tools to be used during the session, if applicable.

tool_choice.description: Specifies which tools the model is allowed to call during the session.

temperature.description: Controls the randomness of the model's output. Range: 0.0 to 1.0. Default is 0.7.

max_response_output_tokens.description: Maximum number of tokens to generate in the response. Default is unlimited.

reasoning_effort.description:
Constrains effort on reasoning for reasoning models. Check model documentation for supported values for each model.
Reducing reasoning effort can result in faster responses and fewer tokens used on reasoning in a response.

filler_response.description: Configuration for filler response generation during latency or tool calls.

agent.description: The agent configuration for the session, if applicable.

id.description: The unique identifier for the session.

ResponseStatusDetails.description: Base for all non-success response details.

ResponseTextContentPart.description: A text content part for a response.

Scene.description: Configuration for avatar's zoom level, position, rotation and movement amplitude in the video frame.

zoom.description: Zoom level of the avatar. Range is (0, +∞). Values less than 1 zoom out, values greater than 1 zoom in.

position_x.description: Horizontal position of the avatar. Range is [-1, 1], as a proportion of frame width. Negative values move left, positive values move right.

position_y.description: Vertical position of the avatar. Range is [-1, 1], as a proportion of frame height. Negative values move up, positive values move down.

rotation_x.description: Rotation around the X-axis (pitch). Range is [-π, π] in radians. Negative values rotate up, positive values rotate down.

rotation_y.description: Rotation around the Y-axis (yaw). Range is [-π, π] in radians. Negative values rotate left, positive values rotate right.

rotation_z.description: Rotation around the Z-axis (roll). Range is [-π, π] in radians. Negative values rotate anticlockwise, positive values rotate clockwise.

amplitude.description: Amplitude of the avatar movement. Range is (0, 1]. Values in (0, 1) mean reduced amplitude, 1 means full amplitude.

ServerEventConversationItemCreated.description:
Returned when a conversation item is created. There are several scenarios that produce this event:
- The server is generating a Response, which if successful will produce
either one or two Items, which will be of type `message`
(role `assistant`) or type `function_call`.
- The input audio buffer has been committed, either by the client or the
server (in `server_vad` mode). The server will take the content of the
input audio buffer and add it to a new user message Item.
- The client has sent a `conversation.item.create` event to add a new Item
to the Conversation.

previous_item_id.description:
The ID of the preceding item in the Conversation context, allows the
client to understand the order of the conversation.

ServerEventConversationItemDeleted.description:
Returned when an item in the conversation is deleted by the client with a
`conversation.item.delete` event. This event is used to synchronize the
server's understanding of the conversation history with the client's view.

item_id.description: The ID of the item that was deleted.

ServerEventConversationItemInputAudioTra.description:
This event is the output of audio transcription for user audio written to the
user audio buffer. Transcription begins when the input audio buffer is
committed by the client or server (in `server_vad` mode). Transcription runs
asynchronously with Response creation, so this event may come before or after
the Response events.
VoiceLive API models accept audio natively, and thus input transcription is a
separate process run on a separate ASR (Automatic Speech Recognition) model.
The transcript may diverge somewhat from the model's interpretation, and
should be treated as a rough guide.

item_id.description: The ID of the user message item containing the audio.

content_index.description: The index of the content part containing the audio.

ServerEventConversationItemInputAudioTra.description: Returned when the text value of an input audio transcription content part is updated.

item_id.description: The ID of the item.

content_index.description: The index of the content part in the item's content array.

logprobs.description: The log probabilities of the transcription.

ServerEventConversationItemInputAudioTra.description:
Returned when input audio transcription is configured, and a transcription
request for a user message failed. These events are separate from other
`error` events so that the client can identify the related Item.

item_id.description: The ID of the user message item.

content_index.description: The index of the content part containing the audio.

ServerEventConversationItemRetrieved.description: Returned when a conversation item is retrieved with `conversation.item.retrieve`.

ServerEventConversationItemTruncated.description:
Returned when an earlier assistant audio message item is truncated by the
client with a `conversation.item.truncate` event. This event is used to
synchronize the server's understanding of the audio with the client's playback.
This action will truncate the audio and remove the server-side text transcript
to ensure there is no text in the context that hasn't been heard by the user.

item_id.description: The ID of the assistant message item that was truncated.

content_index.description: The index of the content part that was truncated.

audio_end_ms.description: The duration up to which the audio was truncated, in milliseconds.

ServerEventError.description:
Returned when an error occurs, which could be a client problem or a server
problem. Most errors are recoverable and the session will stay open, we
recommend to implementors to monitor and log error messages by default.

param.description: Parameter related to the error, if any.

event_id.description: The event_id of the client event that caused the error, if applicable.

ServerEventInputAudioBufferCleared.description:
Returned when the input audio buffer is cleared by the client with a
`input_audio_buffer.clear` event.

ServerEventInputAudioBufferCommitted.description:
Returned when an input audio buffer is committed, either by the client or
automatically in server VAD mode. The `item_id` property is the ID of the user
message item that will be created, thus a `conversation.item.created` event
will also be sent to the client.

previous_item_id.description: The ID of the preceding item after which the new item will be inserted.

item_id.description: The ID of the user message item that will be created.

ServerEventInputAudioBufferSpeechStarted.description:
Sent by the server when in `server_vad` mode to indicate that speech has been
detected in the audio buffer. This can happen any time audio is added to the
buffer (unless speech is already detected). The client may want to use this
event to interrupt audio playback or provide visual feedback to the user.
The client should expect to receive a `input_audio_buffer.speech_stopped` event
when speech stops. The `item_id` property is the ID of the user message item
that will be created when speech stops and will also be included in the
`input_audio_buffer.speech_stopped` event (unless the client manually commits
the audio buffer during VAD activation).

audio_start_ms.description:
Milliseconds from the start of all audio written to the buffer during the
session when speech was first detected. This will correspond to the
beginning of audio sent to the model, and thus includes the
`prefix_padding_ms` configured in the Session.

item_id.description: The ID of the user message item that will be created when speech stops.

ServerEventInputAudioBufferSpeechStopped.description:
Returned in `server_vad` mode when the server detects the end of speech in
the audio buffer. The server will also send an `conversation.item.created`
event with the user message item that is created from the audio buffer.

audio_end_ms.description:
Milliseconds since the session started when speech stopped. This will
correspond to the end of audio sent to the model, and thus includes the
`min_silence_duration_ms` configured in the Session.

item_id.description: The ID of the user message item that will be created.
The item ID.
The item ID.

ServerEventMcpListToolsInProgress.description: MCP list tools in progress message.

item_id.description: The item ID.

ServerEventResponseAnimationBlendshapeDe.description: Represents a delta update of blendshape animation frames for a specific output of a response.

ServerEventResponseAnimationBlendshapeDo.description: Indicates the completion of blendshape animation processing for a specific output of a response.

ServerEventResponseAnimationVisemeDelta.description: Represents a viseme ID delta update for animation based on audio.

ServerEventResponseAnimationVisemeDone.description: Indicates completion of viseme animation delivery for a response.

ServerEventResponseAudioDelta.description: Returned when the model-generated audio is updated.

item_id.description: The ID of the item.

output_index.description: The index of the output item in the response.

content_index.description: The index of the content part in the item's content array.

ServerEventResponseAudioDone.description:
Returned when the model-generated audio is done. Also emitted when a Response
is interrupted, incomplete, or cancelled.

item_id.description: The ID of the item.

output_index.description: The index of the output item in the response.

content_index.description: The index of the content part in the item's content array.

ServerEventResponseAudioTimestampDelta.description: Represents a word-level audio timestamp delta for a response.

ServerEventResponseAudioTimestampDone.description: Indicates completion of audio timestamp delivery for a response.

ServerEventResponseAudioTranscriptDelta.description: Returned when the model-generated transcription of audio output is updated.

item_id.description: The ID of the item.

output_index.description: The index of the output item in the response.

content_index.description: The index of the content part in the item's content array.

ServerEventResponseAudioTranscriptDone.description:
Returned when the model-generated transcription of audio output is done
streaming. Also emitted when a Response is interrupted, incomplete, or
cancelled.

item_id.description: The ID of the item.

output_index.description: The index of the output item in the response.

content_index.description: The index of the content part in the item's content array.

transcript.description: The final transcript of the audio.

ServerEventResponseContentPartAdded.description:
Returned when a new content part is added to an assistant message item during
response generation.

item_id.description: The ID of the item to which the content part was added.

output_index.description: The index of the output item in the response.

content_index.description: The index of the content part in the item's content array.

part.description: The content part that was added.

ServerEventResponseContentPartDone.description:
Returned when a content part is done streaming in an assistant message item.
Also emitted when a Response is interrupted, incomplete, or cancelled.

item_id.description: The ID of the item.

output_index.description: The index of the output item in the response.

content_index.description: The index of the content part in the item's content array.

part.description: The content part that is done.

ServerEventResponseCreated.description:
Returned when a new Response is created. The first event of response creation,
where the response is in an initial state of `in_progress`.

ServerEventResponseDone.description:
Returned when a Response is done streaming. Always emitted, no matter the
final state. The Response object included in the `response.done` event will
include all output Items in the Response but will omit the raw audio data.

ServerEventResponseFoundryAgentCallArgum.description: Represents a delta update of the arguments for a Foundry agent call.

item_id.description: The ID of the item associated with the event.

response_id.description: The ID of the response associated with the event.

output_index.description: The index of the output associated with the event.

ServerEventResponseFoundryAgentCallArgum.description: Indicates the completion of the arguments for a Foundry agent call.

item_id.description: The ID of the item associated with the event.

response_id.description: The ID of the response associated with the event.

output_index.description: The index of the output associated with the event.

arguments.description: The full arguments for the agent call.

ServerEventResponseFoundryAgentCallCompl.description: Indicates the Foundry agent call has completed.

item_id.description: The ID of the item associated with the event.

output_index.description: The index of the output associated with the event.

ServerEventResponseFoundryAgentCallFaile.description: Indicates the Foundry agent call has failed.

item_id.description: The ID of the item associated with the event.

output_index.description: The index of the output associated with the event.

ServerEventResponseFoundryAgentCallInPro.description: Indicates the Foundry agent call is in progress.

item_id.description: The ID of the item associated with the event.

output_index.description: The index of the output associated with the event.

agent_response_id.description: The ID of the agent response, if any.

ServerEventResponseFunctionCallArguments.description: Returned when the model-generated function call arguments are updated.

item_id.description: The ID of the function call item.

output_index.description: The index of the output item in the response.

call_id.description: The ID of the function call.

delta.description: The arguments delta as a JSON string.

ServerEventResponseFunctionCallArguments.description:
Returned when the model-generated function call arguments are done streaming.
Also emitted when a Response is interrupted, incomplete, or cancelled.

item_id.description: The ID of the function call item.

output_index.description: The index of the output item in the response.

call_id.description: The ID of the function call.

arguments.description: The final arguments as a JSON string.

name.description: The name of the function call.

ServerEventResponseMcpCallArgumentsDelta.description: Represents a delta update of the arguments for an MCP tool call.

item_id.description: The ID of the item associated with the event.

response_id.description: The ID of the response associated with the event.

output_index.description: The index of the output associated with the event.

ServerEventResponseMcpCallArgumentsDone.description: Indicates the completion of the arguments for an MCP tool call.

item_id.description: The ID of the item associated with the event.

response_id.description: The ID of the response associated with the event.

output_index.description: The index of the output associated with the event.

arguments.description: The full arguments for the tool call.

ServerEventResponseMcpCallCompleted.description: Indicates the MCP call has completed.

item_id.description: The ID of the item associated with the event.

output_index.description: The index of the output associated with the event.

ServerEventResponseMcpCallFailed.description: Indicates the MCP call has failed.

item_id.description: The ID of the item associated with the event.

output_index.description: The index of the output associated with the event.

item_id.description: The ID of the item associated with the event.

output_index.description: The index of the output associated with the event.

ServerEventResponseOutputItemAdded.description: Returned when a new Item is created during Response generation.

response_id.description: The ID of the Response to which the item belongs.

output_index.description: The index of the output item in the Response.

ServerEventResponseOutputItemDone.description:
Returned when an Item is done streaming. Also emitted when a Response is
interrupted, incomplete, or cancelled.

response_id.description: The ID of the Response to which the item belongs.

output_index.description: The index of the output item in the Response.

ServerEventResponseTextDelta.description: Returned when the text value of a "text" content part is updated.

item_id.description: The ID of the item.

output_index.description: The index of the output item in the response.

content_index.description: The index of the content part in the item's content array.

ServerEventResponseTextDone.description:
Returned when the text value of a "text" content part is done streaming. Also
emitted when a Response is interrupted, incomplete, or cancelled.

item_id.description: The ID of the item.

output_index.description: The index of the output item in the response.

content_index.description: The index of the content part in the item's content array.

ServerEventSessionAvatarConnecting.description: Sent when the server is in the process of establishing an avatar media connection and provides its SDP answer.

server_sdp.description: The server's SDP answer for the avatar connection.

ServerEventSessionCreated.description:
Returned when a Session is created. Emitted automatically when a new
connection is established as the first server event. This event will contain
the default Session configuration.

ServerEventSessionUpdated.description:
Returned when a session is updated with a `session.update` event, unless
there is an error.

ServerEventType.description: Server event types used in VoiceLive protocol.

ServerEventWarning.description:
Returned when a warning occurs that does not interrupt the conversation flow.
Warnings are informational and the session will continue normally.

param.description: Parameter related to the warning, if any.

ServerVad.description: Base model for VAD-based turn detection.

SystemMessageItem.description: A system message item within a conversation.

TokenUsage.description: Overall usage statistics for a response.

Tool.description: The base representation of a voicelive tool definition.

ToolChoiceFunctionObject.description: The representation of a voicelive tool_choice selecting a named function tool.

ToolChoiceLiteral.description: The available set of mode-level, string literal tool_choice options for the voicelive endpoint.

values.name: auto
values.description: Specifies that the model should freely determine which tool or tools, if any, to call.

values.name: none
values.description: Specifies that the model should call no tools whatsoever.

values.name: required
values.description: Specifies that the model should call at least one tool.

ToolChoiceObject.description: A base representation for a voicelive tool_choice selecting a named tool.

ToolType.description:
The supported tool type discriminators for voicelive tools.
Currently, only 'function' tools are supported.

TurnDetection.description: Top-level union for turn detection configuration.

UserMessageItem.description: A user message item within a conversation.

VideoCrop.description: Defines a video crop rectangle using top-left and bottom-right coordinates.

top_left.description: Top-left corner of the crop region. Array of [x, y], must be non-negative integers.

bottom_right.description: Bottom-right corner of the crop region. Array of [x, y], must be non-negative integers.

bitrate.description: Bitrate in bits per second (e.g., 2000000 for 2 Mbps).

codec.description: Codec to use for encoding. Currently only 'h264' is supported.

crop.description: Optional cropping settings for the video stream.

resolution.description: Optional resolution settings for the video stream.

background.description: Optional background settings for the video. Allows specifying either a solid color or an image URL.

gop_size.description: Group of Pictures (GOP) size for video encoding. Controls the interval between keyframes, affecting compression efficiency and seeking performance.

VideoResolution.description: Resolution of the video feed in pixels.

width.description: Width of the video in pixels. Must be greater than 0.

height.description: Height of the video in pixels. Must be greater than 0.

VoiceLiveErrorDetails.description: Error object returned in case of API failure.

code.description: Error code, or null if unspecified.

param.description: Parameter name related to the error, if applicable.

type.description: Type or category of the error.
